intro: Lastrea zeylanica, commonly known as the Ceylon spurge, is a flowering plant native to Sri Lanka. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that is toxic and can cause skin irritation. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
